column4: hey guys, im trying to install 8.10 on this laptop. It has XP on it already. It is an old laptop so I ran chkdsk on it and it reported no errors but when I try to install Ubuntu it comes up with an I/O error, dev 0, sector xxxxx
when exactly do you get this error
I have put the disc in to run ubuntu from the disc...i choose english, choose try ubuntu without installing, the prgress bar bounces back and forth a few times and then it does it
disc is bad then probably, has nothing to do with the hard drive as the live cd shouldnt be using it at that point
ah ok, ty then...good job im downloading koala...i just wanted to get the disc wiped and partitioned while i was waiting for koala to finsih downloading
ty for your help...oh hang on
its loading other bits ok but some bits im still getting an i/o error on
you know when you start from the disc it lists a load of processes with [ok]
yeah, im guessing parts of the disc are unreadable
hmm it seems to be booting into the desktop fine
nah its hung on the plain brown screen after username....oh well lol
or do ubuntu cds not have that anymore
i think 8.10 does, yeah i will try that
